ranking.description: An agentic skills framework & software development methodology that works.
ranking.readme_summary: Superpowers Superpowers is a complete software development workflow for your coding agents, built on top of a set of composable "skills" and some initial instructions that make sure your agent uses them. How it works It starts from the moment you fire up your coding agent. As soon as it sees that you're building something, it *doesn't* just jump into trying to write code

ranking.description: A free, open source, and extensible speech-to-text application that works completely offline.
ranking.readme_summary: Handy ![Discord](https://discord.com/invite/WVBeWsNXK4) **A free, open source, and extensible speech-to-text application that works completely offline.** Handy is a cross-platform desktop application built with Tauri (Rust + React/TypeScript) that provides simple, privacy-focused speech transcription. Press a shortcut, speak, and have your words appear in any text fieldâ€”all without sending your voice to the cloud. Why Handy? Handy was created to fill the gap for a truly open source, extensible s...

ranking.description: AGENTS.md â€” a simple, open format for guiding coding agents
ranking.readme_summary: AGENTS.md !AGENTS.md logo AGENTS.md is a simple, open format for guiding coding agents. Think of AGENTS.md as a README for agents: a dedicated, predictable place to provide context and instructions to help AI coding agents work on your project. Below is a minimal example of an AGENTS.md file: Website This repository also includes a basic Next.js website hosted at https://agents.md/ that explains the projectâ€™s goals in a simple way, and featuring some examples
